summary: This is an email chain from February 2020 regarding the processing of materials seized from Jeffrey Epstein. The FBI's Computer Analysis and Response Team (CART) provided a hard drive from devices seized in the Epstein case, which needs to be uploaded to Relativity for a privilege review. The correspondence indicates an ongoing process of handling evidence, with another batch expected.

events.title: Email correspondence about Epstein evidence processing
events.description: Email chain discussing the status of uploading materials from an FBI CART hard drive to Relativity for privilege review. The materials were seized from devices in connection with the Epstein case.

events.title: Receipt of FBI CART hard drive
events.description: A hard drive processed by the FBI's Computer Analysis and Response Team from devices seized in the Epstein case was received and needs to be uploaded for privilege review.

keyFacts: The FBI's Computer Analysis and Response Team (CART) processed materials from devices seized in the Jeffrey Epstein case.
A hard drive containing these processed materials was received and needed to be uploaded to Relativity for a privilege review.
The email indicates an ongoing evidence handling process, with another batch of materials from the FBI expected to follow.
